data.title: Career Opportunities
data.meta_description: We are hiring! View all of our open positions. Search, find and apply to job opportunities at Quanta Technology.
data.text:
This position is responsible for maintaining existing and developing new businesses in the Central West region of the United States. This person is responsible for promoting key service offerings, setting commercial strategy with clients, creating a business plan, tracking against this plan, and delivering business results. The delivering business results for this position is meeting or exceeding sales targets for the region. The Director is also responsible for leadership with regard to business leads, proposals, and contract cycles across the technical/operations teams of Quanta Technology. It also includes support for mentoring, career planning, motivation, conflict resolution, and resource management. The Central West market segment includes but is not limited to electric utilities/power system operators in Arizona, New Mexico, Texas, Colorado, and Nevada.

The Digital Transformation team is looking for an experienced and motivated senior engineer specializing in electric system utility processes and applications to join Quanta Technology! The primary focus of this position will be to lead and implement engineering solutions for the power systems industry to meet the emerging technical and regulatory challenges of the 21st century. These solutions cover the utilization of innovative automation and integration techniques to improve power system utility processes across all technical departments.

The Digital Transformation team is looking for an experienced and motivated engineer specializing in electric system utility processes and applications to join Quanta Technology! The primary focus of this position will be to lead and implement engineering solutions for the power systems industry to meet the emerging technical and regulatory challenges of the 21st century. These solutions cover the utilization of innovative automation and integration techniques to improve power system utility processes across all technical departments.

The Transmission & Regulatory group is looking for a junior-level power system engineer to join its dynamic consulting team across North America – US and Canada. The candidate will work with senior-level engineers to collectively work and meet project objectives. The role requires performing power network modeling and analyses based on knowledge and expertise in power generation and transmission principles. The engineer is expected to contribute towards the successful completion of a range of consulting projects focused on power system planning studies involving Power System Economics, Market Analysis, Market Intelligence, Steady-State, Short Circuit and Dynamic Stability, Generator and Renewables Interconnections.

The Transmission & Regulatory group is looking for mid-level power system engineers and leaders to join its dynamic consulting team across North America – US and Canada. The Senior Engineer will independently conduct generation and transmission projects, control the budget, and direct junior-level engineers to collectively work and meet project objectives. Work will be performed under the guidance of senior staff. The role requires performing power network modeling and analyses based on knowledge and expertise in power generation and transmission principles. The engineer is expected to contribute towards the successful completion of a range of consulting projects focused on power system planning studies involving Power System Economics, Market Analysis, Market Intelligence, Grid Resilience, Steady-State, Short Circuit and Dynamic Stability, Generator, and Renewables Interconnections.

The Transmission & Regulatory group is looking for mid-senior to senior-level power system engineers and leaders to join its dynamic consulting team across North America - US and Canada. The candidate will independently conduct generation and transmission projects, control the budget, and direct junior-level engineers to collectively work and meet project objectives.

The Transmission & Regulatory group is looking for mid-level to senior-level experienced engineers, to join our growing Transmission consulting practice. The role requires performing power flow modeling and a broad range of planning analyses based on knowledge and expertise of power system principles. The candidate is expected to contribute towards the successful completion of a range of consulting projects focused on Transmission planning studies involving Steady State, Short Circuit and Dynamic Stability, Generator and Renewable Interconnections, Public Policy, TPL Compliance and, Economic and Market analysis.

The position of Senior Advisor is an important technical position within Quanta Technology within the Substation practice area of the Asset Management business area. It is reserved for subject matter experts with demonstrated technical skills and the ability to independently write proposals, manage and execute projects, and help with opportunity identification and client management. A Senior Advisor is encouraged to build a strong industry presence and aim at becoming one of the top-recognized people in their area in the future.

The Project Manager will oversee the entire project life cycle from initiation to closure, playing a critical role in ensuring successful project delivery. You will develop clear plans, allocate resources efficiently, manage project budgets and ensure compliance with regulatory and contractual obligations. Leading project teams, you will prioritize clear communication with stakeholders, deliver reports and oversee the comprehensive close-out of projects. Your leadership and strategic oversight will be instrumental in achieving project goals. You will be part of Quanta Technology's Strategy and Program Management team within Grid Architecture, dedicated to managing the full spectrum of organizational dynamics, from strategy to portfolio and program management to business process optimization. Our team comprises seasoned experts and young talents with extensive experience and fresh perspectives in the utility and energy industries. We foster a strong team spirit and a collaborative environment, supporting each other to achieve excellence and continuous improvement in every project.

The Project Management Analyst is responsible for supporting the Project Management Office on projects for utility industry clients. They will leverage reporting tools to organize and plan complex projects while supporting process development and implementation. This is a multi-faceted role in the Project Management Office with focus on data analysis.

The Investment Planning Management Services Advisor is responsible for leading efforts to improve operational and project delivery processes managed by utility industry clients. They will leverage process development techniques and analytical tools to organize and plan complex projects while supporting implementation and communication. This is a multi-faceted role with a focus on building capabilities within client companies to execute larger volumes of work. The Investment Planning Management Services Advisor must be able to understand complex industry and technical challenges to develop and lead solutions at the tactical level.

As a Senior Advisor specializing in AI Applications in Power System Studies at Quanta Technology, you will be at the forefront of integrating cutting-edge AI technologies into power system reliability and resilience planning. This senior role is ideal for a high-performing individual with hands-on experience in AI solution architecture, particularly in the Generative AI (GAI) domain. You will lead a team of experts, manage complex projects, and drive innovation in the industry.

The Senior/Lead Application Support Administrator will play a crucial role in the administration, maintenance, security, and optimization of the organization's financial applications and databases. This position ensures the smooth operation, high performance, and integrity of critical financial systems, including those for accounting, banking, trading, and reporting. Key responsibilities include overseeing daily operations, supporting users, managing system integrity, implementing security measures, ensuring regulatory compliance, and enhancing system performance. The role involves maintaining data accuracy, providing technical support to end-users, and offering technical guidance across the organization. The Administrator also collaborates with external consultants to meet project timelines and deliverables. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in database administration and financial application support, ensuring the effectiveness and reliability of the organization’s financial operations.

We have an immediate need for an Advanced Testing Advisor with experience in power systems, Real Time Digital Simulation (RTDS) systems and hardware in the loop (HIL) testing of protection and control equipment. The Advanced Testing Advisor will work closely with and learn from Quanta Technology’s team of industry-leading advisors and technical experts as they provide testing services to our customers and conduct research on emerging issues in the power industry.

As a Business Analyst at Quanta Technology, you will work in a multi-disciplinary, entrepreneurial environment using data to provide real-world impact for our clients in the power & utilities industry with their most pressing challenges with energy transition, climate risk & resilience, infrastructure financing, energy analytics, and digitalization, among other things. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

The Climate Risk Analytics Principal Consultant at Quanta Technology will work in a multi-disciplinary, entrepreneurial environment. Using skills and understanding of power systems, provide real-world impact for our clients in the power & utilities industry with their most pressing challenges with energy transition, climate risk & resilience, infrastructure financing, energy analytics, and digitalization, among other things.

This position is responsible for maintaining existing and developing new business in Canada. This person is responsible for promoting key service offerings, setting commercial strategy with clients, creating a business plan, tracking against this plan, and delivering business results. The delivering business results for this position is meeting or exceeding sales targets for Canada. The Director is also responsible for leadership with regards to business leads, proposals, and contract cycles across the technical/operations teams of Quanta Technology. It also includes support for mentoring, career planning, motivation, conflict resolution, and resource management.

This position is responsible for developing new business in the Commercial and Industrial (C&I) markets in the US and Canada. This person is responsible for promoting key service offerings, setting commercial strategy with clients, creating a business plan, tracking against this plan, and delivering business results. The delivering business results for this position is meeting or exceeding sales targets for the C&I market segment. The Director is also responsible for leadership with regards to business leads, proposals, and contract cycles across the technical/operations teams of Quanta Technology. It also includes support for mentoring, career planning, motivation, conflict resolution, and resource management.

The primary focus for this position will be to lead and contribute to prototyping, designing, and developing software solutions for the power systems industry. The right candidate will have demonstrable experience, multitask with different roles in various projects, capitalize on the team’s skills and experience to create new solutions, and mentor others

The primary focus of this position is to support the integration of technology for emerging applications of power electronics and advanced controls and protection in energy systems (e.g., energy storage systems, Microgrids, etc.). The position requires hands-on experience and previous engagements in the development and troubleshooting of systems in the field or as part of integration process support in a laboratory environment. The candidate should have experience with programming/configuring control and automation devices and SCADA systems from various North American vendors, such as SEL (e.g., RTAC, AXION, SEL relays), Nova Tech (Orion LX), SCADA packages (e.g., Ignition, Simatic, Zenon, etc.). The successful candidate should demonstrate strong technical skills and proficiency in the integration process of utility control, monitoring, and automation systems. The ideal candidate will be able to lead the team from both the technical and business aspects of projects.

This position will lead a technical team that builds models, performs system studies, and verifies design with the use of hardware-in-the-loop testing of P&C systems in the laboratory environment for distributed energy solutions and microgrids. The successful candidate will be accountable for conceptual and primary design, modeling, analysis, and laboratory testing of Distributed Energy Systems including microgrids, energy storage-based systems for non-wire alternatives, captive power plants, and grid automation applications. The candidate should have 10+ years of experience and in-depth knowledge of Protection and Control (P&C) systems, distributed control systems, distribution automation, and system interconnections in the areas of renewable energy systems and microgrids. The position requires verifying the results of system analysis and evaluating the design based on studies.

Engineers I, II, and III are critical technical positions within Quanta Technology. They will use and develop their technical skills to support projects, build an industry presence, and work towards becoming a recognized expert in their technical area in the future. Engineers will be responsible for executing work under the direction of a higher-ranked engineer.

Quanta Technology is growing rapidly and has an immediate need for a Relay Settings Engineer with experience in protection and control of electrical networks. We are addressing the challenges of today and tomorrow on topics such as the high penetration of DERs, the transition to IEC 61850, grid analytics, SMU applications, fire risk mitigation, compliance, and continued AMI deployments, as well as other grid modernization topics. Join this dynamic team and help us make a difference realizing the electrical grid of the future.

We are looking for experienced protection and control engineers who are interested in joining our growing team of experts. As a member of our Protection Settings group, you will work on protection short circuit studies, coordination studies, relay settings, and peer reviews alongside industry leaders.

We have an immediate need for an Energy Efficiency / Demand Response Consultant with experience in power systems and advanced metering for the electrical grid of the future and automating the water and gas delivery/metering solutions for reliable, resilient, and sustainable grid/distribution systems. Join our dynamic team and help us make a difference in realizing the Energy Efficiency / Demand Response helping our customers address electrification and building a carbon-conservative energy ecosystem!

We have an immediate need for an AMI Advisor with experience in power systems and advanced metering for the electrical grid of the future and automating the water and gas delivery / metering solutions for a reliable, resilient, and sustainable grid / distribution systems.
